description:

We have a slot in Room3, from 17:00 till 17:55.

"men zegge het voort"

 

See you there

 

Grts

 

Johan

venue.name: Loaddays - Don Bosco werken en leren

name: Kickoff meeting Belgian Puppet User Group

description:
By Jan Vansteenkiste

Jan did gave a presentaion @ puppetcamp Ghent : http://vstone.eu/talks/puppet-module-testing

More details will be published when available.

Before coming to the workshop, make sure you have ruby, rubygems and bundler installed.

Also, I don't wanna be an ass, but I've been using ruby 1.9 lately... Maybe we'll have to work-around some ruby 1.8 issues while we go through it.

Short Agenda:

* Vagrant (skipping through)
* Testing (Setup)
** ruby/bundler stuffs
** rake tralala
* Tools
** rspec-puppet
** puppetlabs_spec_helper
** hiera puppet testing (?)
** rspec-augeas
* Extra
** travis-ci
name: Workshop testing puppet modules

description:
We'd love to have you join us either in person or online for our
Triage-a-Thon on July 13th!

Our goal is to review all open tickets in the Puppet and Module
projects. We’ll assign blocks of tickets to every participant, explain
how to participate, and have the IRC channel #puppethack on Freenode
for remote participants. The first 200 people who help for at least 2
hours will get a special edition Puppet Triage-a-Thon 2013 t-shirt,
and we'll have additional prizes for top participants!

REGISTER: http://triagepuppet2013.eventbrite.com/

For those who participate from the Puppet Labs Portland office, we'll
provide breakfast, a delicious lunch, snacks, and plenty of space for
you to work and collaborate.

I hope to see you there!

Thanks,
Dawn Foster
Puppet Community Lead
http://puppetlabs.com/community
name: Triage-a-Thon

description:
Two proposed subjects for this event:

1) Using hiera in rspec testing

Although hiera data is now loaded automatically when using a parameterized class or defined type, there are still scenarios that require you to test hiera manually.

Learning how to do this will give you insights into the internals of rspec testing.

 

2) Using travis-ci.org continuous integration

So you've got your code pushed to github and rspec tests give it a clean bill of health. But will it work for multiple versions of ruby/puppet/facter?

We will show how to set up your code for testing on Travis, which automates these testing scenarios for you, and reports back its findings. We'll show how this integrates with github.

(sorry for using English :)

If needed, depending on the knowledge of the attendents, I ( Johan) will give a quick introduction to hiera.    This can be skipped if all attendees already have enough experience with hiera ...

 

Dit is een initieel voorstel

Plaats, tijd en onderwerp is nog aanpasbaar.

 

Een hands on om hiera te gebruiken,

- De goede kantjes

- De minder gopede kantjes

- Eventueel voorstellen wat anders kan

Testen van hiera

Ik ben momenteel een pging aan het wagen om een hiera backend te schrijven, en kan dat op de meeting een beetje uit de doeken doen.

Voor zij die interesse hebben om iets op de workshop te doen, graag een mailtje.

 

Tot dan

(BTW, OK dat we in het nederlands verder gaan ?? )

johan

venue.name: HoGent campus Schoonmeersen, gebouw B, lokaal B.3.020

name: Something about hiera

description:
This time, the meetup will be more a workshop. 


The idea is to have a kind of (moderated ??) discussion about how to manage files in puppet with the augeas resource,  getting to know some tools to help write the correct resource code (eg. augtool) and possible alternative we can use with puppet to manage just some lines and/or single keywords in a file, without bringing the complete file under puppet's control.

Feel free to add extra information, ideas etc to this meetup.


PS. we are still open for suggestions about locations
name: Something about augeas

description:
The Puppet User groups have a stand @ Fosdem. We got one table.
Agenda :
* Practical stuff for fosdem
* We, as PUG on cfgmgmtcamp.eu - We are doing a talk about rspec.
* Next meetup - talking about or puppet env setup. More detailed planning
(with fosdem and cfgmgmtcam we are all very busy at januar)

Looking for some place to make this happen. (if none, Offices@Open-future).
Any suggestions welcome.
name: New Years Meetup

description:
We we populate a puppet stand@ fosdem.
Details will follow when available
name: Fosdem - puppet user group stand

description:
At This meetup, we invite everyone to present their current puppet environment they are working with in their daily job. This can range form a single puppet server setup, how the modules are deployed, masterless setup, integration of puppet with third party software, the flow, from developing a manifest, till the deploy of it in production.
For those willing to take the lead and present something of there infrastructure, please contact me, so we can arrange an interesting schedule.

We will doing this type of meetings multiple times a year, depending on how this concept works.

Hope to see you all.

Johan
name: Round Table Puppet Infrastructure Setup

description: Just having a drink and a chat.
name: March Drinkup

description:
This will be our first inter user group event. We will join the AWS user group to learn a lot about AWS, and how Puppet could be used get the most out of AWS.
See also the AWS user group's page for more info :
http://www.meetup.com/AWS-User-Group-Belgium/
name: AWS and Puppet

description:
Time to meet-up again. Since mcollective got the most votes, we will do something with/about mcollective.
We are now looking for someone who wants to take the lead of this meetup, and guide the rest of us so mcollective will step out of the 'mystery fog' ...
name: something about mcollective

" De kogel is door de kerk"

we'll (Inuits)  provide a snack and drinks ..

name: Holiday is over  Meetup !!!

description:
Mattias Geniar  is managing its Zabbix monitoring setup with puppet at Nucleus, and is willing to show us the how's and why's. Also some demos are included.

This meetup is organized together with the Belgian Zabbix User Group.

Beside puppet related information, I'm sure we will have a great opportunity to get introduced to Zabbix.

See you there.

Thanks Mattias for organizing this meetup.
name: Managing Zabbix with Puppet  @ Nucleus
